book_name: An Elegant Puzzle - Systems of Engineering Management - by Will Larson.pdf
summary: Transitioning into a managerial role often brings about feelings of anxiety, especially when one loses touch with previous sources of fulfillment. The challenge becomes managing problems without resorting to overworking, as traditional habits may no longer serve effectively. To tackle this, a practical tool is proposed: for each problem, choose to either close out, solve, or delegate. This method encourages proactive decision-making, helping to prevent previous tasks from resurfacing. By implementing this framework, managers can navigate their responsibilities more efficiently and regain a sense of control.

slides.section_title: Transition to Management Can Be Challenging
slides.section_body: Stepping into a managerial role often leads to feelings of detachment and anxiety. Many miss the hands-on teamwork that once brought them joy. This shift can invoke uncertainty about one's impact on the team.
slides.quote: Transitioning to managing managers can feel unsettling.

slides.section_body: The skills that propelled your career might not be effective in your new role. The tendency to outwork problems could lead to burnout or inefficiency. Recognizing this is vital to progressing.
slides.quote: Outworking your problems doesnâ€™t work as a manager.

slides.section_body: To manage effectively, it's essential to adopt a structured approach to problem-solving. When faced with challenges, a clear method can guide your decisions and help regaining control.
slides.quote: A defined strategy will navigate your responsibilities better.

slides.section_body: For every problem, choose one of three strategies: Close out, Solve, or Delegate. This framework simplifies decision-making and enhances productivity.
slides.quote: Choose wisely: close, solve, or delegate.

slides.section_body: Closing out tasks means resolving them so they won't return. Make a decision and communicate it clearly, ensuring total resolution.
slides.quote: Aim to finish tasks quickly and permanently.

slides.section_body: Solving a task involves creating a solution to prevent similar issues from recurring. This may require developing processes or coaching team members.
slides.quote: Design solutions that last six months or more.

slides.section_body: Delegation directs tasks to qualified individuals. Sometimes this may be a one-off request, but it allows you to focus on more strategic issues.
slides.quote: Delegate to those with the right skills.

slides.section_body: This method prohibits going back to unsustainable practices. It's about making smart decisions that enhance overall efficiency.
slides.quote: Inefficiency leads to a larger pile of work.

slides.section_body: Implement this three-step strategy for a week to see its effectiveness. It can provide clarity and help with decision fatigue.
slides.quote: Give this method a week; see the difference it makes.

slides.section_body: By closing, solving, or delegating tasks, you'll find your rhythm as a manager. Embrace the change and enhance your impact.
slides.quote: Regain confidence as you navigate your new role.
